intro: Cassipourea elliptica var. typica, commonly known as the elliptic cassipourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
